snippet: The release ended a standoff that raised new questions about the fighters just as the United States and other Western nations were grappling over whether to arm them.
abstract: Syrian rebels release 21 detained United Nations peacekeepers to Jordanian forces; release ends a three-day standoff that raised new tensions in the region and new questions about the fighters just as the United States and other nations were grappling over whether to allow more arms to flow to the rebel movement.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HANIA MOURTADA
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Antakya, and Hania Mourtada from Beirut, Lebanon. Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Antakya, Floyd Whaley from Manila and Ranya Kadri from Amman, Jordan.

lead_paragraph: The release ended a standoff that raised new questions about the fighters just as the United States and other Western nations were grappling over whether to arm them.

headline.seo: Syria Rebels Say U.N. Peacekeepers Have Been Released to Jordan
headline.main: Rebels in Syria Release U.N. Peacekeepers to Jordan, Easing Crisis in Border Zone
headline.print_headline: Rebels in Syria Release U.N. Peacekeepers to Jordan, Easing Crisis in Border Zone
